channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19: updates from New Zealand and around the world
item.description: NZ could remain in alert levels 2 and 3 for a "moderate amount of time", according to an official document. Follow all the latest developments with RNZ's live blog.

item.title: 'Getting used to the quiet': family spend lockdown at wildlife park
item.description: Animals at Willowbank Wildlife Reserve in Christchurch have been missing visitors even though one family has lived on site for the duration of the Covid-19 lockdown.

item.title: Month in quarantine bars Brisbane-based man's bid to see dying mum
item.description: A New Zealand man living in Brisbane has given up hope of seeing his dying mother in Auckland because he can't afford to be put in mandatory quarantine on both sides of the Tasman.

item.title: Police pursue stolen milk truck in South Auckland
item.description: A man has been arrested for allegedly stealing a milk truck in South Auckland this morning.

item.title: Royal Commission investigating Christchurch mosque attacks needed extension despite lockdown
item.description: Official documents show the Royal Commission investigating the Christchurch mosque shootings wasn't on track to meet its April deadline before the country went into lockdown.

item.title: Covid-19: NZer in quarantine appeals to government compassion to see dying wife
item.description: A Christchurch man is pleading for government officials to exempt him from quarantine so that he can see his dying wife one last time.

item.title: Covid-19: Government releases hundreds of documents on its response
item.description: The government has released a wealth of material related to its response to the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Covid-19: Developments in New Zealand on 8 May
item.description: The government released more than 300 documents related to its response to the Covid-19 pandemic, two new cases were confirmed and offices and retailers work out how to manage under level 2.

item.title: Work and Income acts 'unlawfully' over benefits and redundancy payments
item.description: Work and Income has been acting "unlawfully" and ignoring its own legislation by telling people paid redundancies that they are not eligible for a benefit till that money runs out.

item.title: Two arrested after 20kg of meth found in suitcase at airport
item.description: Two men have been arrested after 20 kilograms of methamphetamine was found in a carry-on suitcase at Auckland Airport.

item.title: As it happened: Covid-19 updates from NZ and around the world
item.description: Two new cases of Covid-19 were reported today, while the government dumped hundreds of documents related to the virus. See how the day's events unfolded with RNZ's live blog.

item.title: Ski operators pleased to open even if numbers drop sharply
item.description: Ski resorts expect visitor numbers will be cut in half as border closures keep international visitors off the slopes.

item.title: Covid-19: Mercy flights for New Zealanders could cost up to $14m
item.description: It could cost up to $14 million to get New Zealanders stranded overseas because of Covid-19 home, according to just-released documents.

item.title: Two new cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand
item.description: One of two new cases of Covid-19 confirmed today is a nurse who has been caring for St Margaret's cluster patients. Watch the latest briefing here.

item.title: Households set internet consumption record in April
item.description: Households set a new internet consumption record in April, each using almost 500 gigabytes of data.

item.title: Covid-19: Australia woman's travel exemption approved after Kiwi mum dies
item.description: Desperate to get to New Zealand to see her mother before she died, a woman applied for an exemption to the travel ban but it took too long.

item.title: University has plans for bringing back international students
item.description: Victoria University has a plan for international students' quarantine it will put to government, in the hope students will be allowed back before the border reopens.

item.title: Courier contractor ruling could open way for action against other employers
item.description: An employment lawyer says a court finding that an Auckland courier was an employee not a contractor could open the way for similar cases.
